pr_title: BAEL-3341 A Guide to Hibernate Types Project

timeline.bodyText: Should I remove this README file?
timeline.author: andrebrowne

replies.bodyText: let's remove it, we have people creating and managing those
replies.author: rpvilao

replies.bodyText:
Each article in the persistence-module has a README.md file.
This file is also where the instructions for running docker are documented.
If we remove this file where should the docker directions go?
replies.author: andrebrowne

replies.bodyText: these files should only have a link to the articles inside them, they are managed by the people pushing the buttons to go live etc. as for the instructions, being in the article is sufficient, not worries about that
replies.author: rpvilao

timeline.bodyText: Is this ok, or is this change made after the article is published?
timeline.author: andrebrowne

replies.bodyText: not sure what you mean here :)
replies.author: rpvilao

replies.bodyText: In the previous PR you said to remove this because it is usually done after the article is published. But the author docs say to add it. Which one should I do?
replies.author: andrebrowne

replies.bodyText: in the previous PR I said I didn't understand what you meant, I still don't :)
replies.author: rpvilao

replies.bodyText:
@rpvilao Section "how to create a new module" in "baeldung - for authors - 4 - implementation code" says "if the new module is a sub-module, then this should be added to the pom of their parent, instead of the main pom", but you told me not to.
Which one is it.
replies.author: andrebrowne

replies.bodyText: I just looked back at the old PR. You didn't comment on this. I got it mixed up with the readme file.
replies.author: andrebrowne

timeline.message: Add architecture module with Hexagonal example

Revert "Add architecture module with Hexagonal example"

This reverts commit 50efbf3dfb3a951d276c13ab3b8f1a0cadb114d4.

timeline.bodyText: do we need it? it seems we don't get past the maven test goal
timeline.author: rpvilao

timeline.bodyText: $PWD is already an env variable you don't need to run the command
